newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper ends firmer after LME stock drop.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper ends firmer after LME stock drop.

text.p: COMEX copper settled firmer in quiet, but steady trading, the market underpinned by a further draw in LME stocks and labor concerns but much of the day's gains were, nevertheless pared, traders said.
"The market was due for a little bit of a bounce, but it was an unenthusiastic, cautious rally," William O'Neill of Merrill Lynch said.
LME stocks fell 2,125 tonnes to 155,775 tonnes.
May COMEX settled 0.80 cent firmer at 106.25 cents per pound, traded 107.20 to 105.80 cents. Spot April went out 1.15 cents higher at 107.80 cents.
The market was awaiting the outcome of Tuesday's vote at Escondida, the world's biggest copper mine in Chile.
But traders noted that only a small number of the workforce were involved in the vote on whether to accept a new pay deal which the union has recommended rejecting.
Despite Tuesday's modest gains, a cloud still hangs over the red metal charts, O'Neill said. "The technical bias is leaning a bit weaker."
